sense.name: publicize, cause to become widely known throug circulation
sense.examples: He circularizes his trade, sends mailings to advertisers when requested. They published it for about two years, circularizing the profession. During the trial she circularized a fantasy to prove the carpenter innocent.

sense.name: canvass, poll for opinions, support
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] CIRCULARIZE NP2[patient] PP {for NP} Note: Preposition often indicates desired information or purpose of circularizing.
sense.examples: They circularized for information. They circularized all households within easy walking distance. They circularized 30000 of the medical profession, inviting them to reply. The Executive Board was circularized four times on the following matters... He circularizes the owners of receivers he made several years back. In 1922 she circularized medical schools about their teaching of birth control.

sense.name: Distribute circulars: often advertisements or questionaires
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] CIRCULARIZE NP2[recipient] PP{with NP[theme]} Note: thing distributed is often oblique and distributed-to is syntactic object.
sense.examples: He circularizes these customers at intervals with letters and circulars. They circularized all their members with a new list of prices. They circularized all units with a reminder to send in regular returns. They circularized 100000 discount tickets.

sense.name: cause to be circular in shape
sense.examples: They circularized the orbit of their spacecraft.
